intro: Reichardia picroides var. crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers and basal leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture, and the flowers are arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces seeds through a capsule-like structure.
